title: How to Play Ghost

steps.headline: Get a paper and a pencil.
Pick some random word, and you say the first letter.
steps.description: Then have your opponent say the next letter. It goes back and forth like that. Whoever finishes the word first loses that word. Say, "Ghost!" When someone finishes the word. You get a point when your opponent finishes the word.

steps.headline: Have the person who starts say a letter.
Go around in a circle saying letters that form part of a word.
Wait until a word is formed.
See if you can lengthen the word.
steps.description: For example, if someone has just said the 't' in just, you can add an 'i' to make justify or an 'l' to make justi.

steps.headline: End the round when you can't make the word any longer.
steps.description: You gain the letter "g". (It is like the game Horse, where each time you lose you gain a letter.)

text: Two Players Get a paper and a pencil.  Pick some random word, and you say the first letter. Then have your opponent say the next letter. It goes back and forth like that. Whoever finishes the word first loses that word. Say, "Ghost!" When someone finishes the word. You get a point when your opponent finishes the word. Catch their mistakes. like, "To". Have fun and get great!  Three or More Players Gather two or more friends.  Choose someone to start.  Have the person who starts say a letter.  Go around in a circle saying letters that form part of a word.  Wait until a word is formed.  See if you can lengthen the word. For example, if someone has just said the 't' in just, you can add an 'i' to make justify or an 'l' to make justi. End the round when you can't make the word any longer. You gain the letter "g". (It is like the game Horse, where each time you lose you gain a letter.)
